tooltip.description: Places an enchantment on each attack while activated, causing it to deal additional damage based on how far away the target is.  The farther the target, the greater the damage dealt. Deals double damage to creeps and illusions.
tooltip.lore: While Aiushtha favors peaceful means, she is capable of a magical onslaught from a distance, her spears gaining energy from the natural life around her.

tooltip.description:
Enchantress charms an enemy. If the enemy is a hero, they are slowed and damaged for 5s.

 If the enemy is a creep, she brings it under her control, increasing its attack damage and max health. Enchantress can control up to 1 creeps at a time for up to 30s. 

DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltip.lore: A true steward of the forest, Aiushtha befriends all within it - from lowly trolls to powerful centaurs.
tooltip.scepter_description: Enchantress can control multiple creeps at a time.

tooltip.description: A cloud of wisps heals Enchantress and any friendly units nearby. Lasts 9 seconds.
tooltip.lore: Whimsical spirits of the woods possess a healing power that is quite subtle, but gains strength in numbers.

tooltip.description: Leaps backward, dodges incoming projectiles, and launches an Impetus attack on the 2 furthest enemy units within Enchantress' attack range + 100.
tooltip.lore: Sproink is as Sproink does.

tooltip.description: Enchantress roots an enemy unit. All creeps, ally, enemy and neutral within a radius will gain bonus movement and attack speed and attack the chosen target for 6 seconds.
Enchantress beguiles her enemies, slowing their attacks when she is attacked.
tooltip.lore: After attacking Aiushtha, most opponents are overwhelmed with guilt having attacked such a natural beauty.

passive.val: Increases attack range of ranged heroes.
Amplifies the wearer's Regeneration, Healing, Lifesteal and Spell Lifesteal by

entries.name: +85% Breathe Fire Damage/Cast Range in Dragon Form
+400 AoE Dragon Tail During Elder Dragon Form

tooltip.description: Unleashes a breath of fire in front of Dragon Knight that burns enemies and reduces the damage their attacks deal.\n\nApplies the debuff from Corrosive Breath and Frost Breath Dragon Form is of the corresponding level.
tooltip.lore: Knight Davion's breath has become that of the mighty Eldwurm Slyrak, remembered for burning numerous other knights to a crisp.

tooltip.description: Dragon Knight smites an enemy unit in melee range with his shield, stunning it while dealing damage based on their enemy max HP.  When in Elder Dragon Form, the cast range increases to 450.
tooltip.lore: Davion's combination of dragon talents and knightly skills makes him a vicious opponent in melee combat.

tooltip.description: The life blood of the Dragon improves health regeneration and strengthens armor.
tooltip.lore: Slyrak's blood still courses through Davion's veins, giving him twice the vitality of an ordinary knight.

tooltip.description: Ignites an area, dealing damage over time that lingers on enemies in it. Has reduced cast range when melee.

Dragon Knight takes the form of one of three powerful elder dragons, increasing his speed and Dragon Tail's range, while granting him new powers.
LEVEL 1 Green Dragon - Corrosive Breath: attacks deal 25 poison damage per second for 3.0 seconds. Works on structures.
LEVEL 2 Red Dragon - Splash Attack: attacks damage all enemy units in a 350 radius for 75% damage, with Corrosive Breath added to the targets.
LEVEL 3 Blue Dragon - Frost Breath: slows movement speed by 0% and attack speed by 0 of enemy units in Splash Attack range for 0 seconds, with Corrosive Breath added to the targets.
tooltip.lore: The dormant dragon power springs forth from within Davion, combining the powers of a legendary knight with a legendary Eldwurm.
tooltip.scepter_description: Increases the level of Dragon Knight's ultimate. Adds a 4th level, Black Dragon. Black Dragon has bonus Corrosive Damage, Splash Damage and Slow amount, 25% increased Magic Resistance and free pathing.

active.val: % Magic resistance and immunity to pure and reflected damage. For the duration of the effect, any negative effect from enemy spells has no effect.

seconds after taking damage from an enemy hero or Roshan.

passive.val: Upgrades the ultimate, and some abilities, of all heroes.
Places a debuff when you attack enemies, dealing
damage per second and causing them to do
damage if equipped hero is Silenced and
armor if equipped hero is Stunned.

entries.name: +6% Arc Lightning Current Health As Damage

tooltip.description: Hurls a bolt of lightning that leaps through nearby enemy units that deal a base damage and a percentage of their current health.
tooltip.lore: Arc Lightning is Zeus' favorite spell to use against puny mortals.

tooltip.description: Calls down a bolt of lightning to strike an enemy unit, causing damage and a mini-stun. When cast, Lightning Bolt briefly provides unobstructed vision and True Sight around the target in a 750 radius. Can be cast on the ground, affecting the closest enemy hero in 325 range. Deals 100% more damage to creeps.
tooltip.lore: A shocking punishment for rebellious heathen.

tooltip.description: Zeus performs a Heavenly Jump, leaping forward and shocking the closest visible nearby enemy (prioritizing heroes), dealing damage as well as reducing their movement and attack speed. Zeus gets 900 unobstructed vision around him for 3 seconds.
Creates a storm cloud anywhere on the map that automatically casts Lightning Bolt on nearby enemies.
Zeus gains bonus attack range and his attacks create Arc Lightnings that deal a percentage of its damage. Can be toggled off to stop this effect.

Strikes all enemy heroes with a bolt of lightning, no matter where they may be. Does a flat amount of damage and additional damage based on the max health of the target.\n\nThundergod's Wrath also provides True Sight around each hero struck.  If an enemy hero is invisible, it takes no damage, but the True Sight is still created at that hero's location.
tooltip.lore: The Lord of Heaven smites all who oppose him, near or far.

active.val: Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of boots do not stack.
Converts the target unit to ethereal form, rendering them immune to physical damage, but unable to attack and
Enemy targets are also slowed by

passive.val: The next Unit Target spell you cast on an enemy deals a separate
bonus damage to the target, and slows them by
Upgrades the ultimate, and some abilities, of all heroes.

active.val: bonus armor at the cost of -

entries.name: +6 Max / +1 Hero Attack Reactive Armor Stacks

tooltip.description: Timbersaw whirls extremely sharp edges, damaging enemies and destroying trees around him in an area.  If an enemy hero is affected, it loses some of its primary attribute for a short duration.  Whirling Death will deal bonus damage per tree destroyed.
tooltip.lore: In the case that Rizzrack gets surrounded by the vines and plants of his nightmares, he has an immediate chainsaw defense.

tooltip.description: Timbersaw fires a chain that embeds itself in the first tree it hits, pulling him towards it.  Any enemy in the path takes damage.
tooltip.lore: You never know when you might need to escape from malevolent saplings.

tooltip.description: Each time Timbersaw is attacked, he gains increased health regen and armor. Hero attacks are counted as 3x the amount.
tooltip.lore: The saw-suit is equipped to react to the slightest touch with fortified defenses.

tooltip.description: Launches a second independent Chakram.
tooltip.lore: Cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut!

tooltip.description: Releases a flame in the direction Timbersaw is facing. Applies a debuff that deals damage per second and slows enemy movement speed. Affects buildings for reduced damage.

Fires Timbersaw's main saw blade at the target location where it will spin in place, dealing damage in an area around it.  Enemies caught in the saw blade will move more slowly for every 5% of health missing. The blade deals damage and cuts down trees in its path when fired and retracted.  While active the ability costs mana, and Timbersaw loses the ability to attack.
tooltip.lore: The ultimate in anti-flora weaponry.
tooltip.scepter_description: Increases Chakram and Second Chakram damage per second.

active.val: Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of boots do not stack.
Emits a freezing wave that causes enemies to take
magical damage and slows their movement by

and all heals, regeneration and lifesteal by

passive.val: Grants the ability to see invisible units and wards to any allied vision within

magic damage from damage instances over

tooltip.description: Dark Willow creates a maze of brambles that grow in the target area after 0.3 seconds.  Enemies that walk into a bramble are rooted and take damage over time.
tooltip.lore: The fae realm exists all around you, merely waiting to draw you in...

tooltip.description: Dark Willow recedes into the shadows, becoming untargetable.  Her next attack has increased attack range and deals bonus magic damage, and will end Shadow Realm. Damage scales based on how long she remains under the effects of Shadow Realm, the maximum being reached after 3.0 seconds.
tooltip.lore: What you can't see will most definitely hurt you.
tooltip.scepter_description: Attacking no longer takes Dark Willow out of Shadow Realm. Each attack still has bonus damage based on the duration of the buff.

tooltip.description: Dark Willow casts an ancient fae curse on the target. After a delay, the target and nearby enemies are stunned.
tooltip.lore: Didn't anyone ever tell you? Never strike a deal with a fairy...

tooltip.description: Dark Willow sends her pet wisp to roam around an ally for the duration, rapidly attacking nearby enemies.  Bedlam cannot be used while Terrorize is active.
tooltip.lore: You'll have to excuse my friend Jex. He's really into murder.

tooltip.description: Dark Willow releases her pet wisp to terrorize her enemies. After a short delay, all enemies in the target area become fearful and run toward their home fountain. Terrorize cannot be used while Bedlam is active.
tooltip.lore: You think you know the first thing about fear? Jex'll show you what that word truly means...

active.val: Teleport to a target point up to
Blink Dagger cannot be used for
seconds after taking damage from an enemy hero or Roshan.
Turns a target unit into a harmless critter for
seconds. The target has a base movement speed of
and will be silenced, muted, and disarmed.
Sweeps a target unit up into a cyclone, making them invulnerable for
seconds. Cyclone can only be cast on enemy units or yourself.

passive.val: Whenever you attack a hero or are attacked by any unit, the bonus
HP regen is lost and the movement speed bonus is reduced to
Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of boots do not stack.

use.val: Turns the caster and all allied player-controlled units in a
While the caster is still disguised, any allies that come within
range of them will also get the buff applied to them. Each smoke can only be applied once to allies.
range of an enemy hero or tower, will break the invisibility.
Disguise grants invisibility that is immune to True Sight.

tooltip.description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun. Deals double damage to creeps.
tooltip.lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.

tooltip.description: Forms a barrier of energized cogs around Clockwerk, trapping any units that are near. Allies in the cogs when they are created receive a magic damage barrier. Enemies outside the trap that touch a cog are knocked back, losing health and mana. Damage is increased by 50% of the mana burned.\n\nOnce a cog has delivered a shock, it will power down.  Cogs can be destroyed by enemy attacks, but Clockwerk can destroy them with just one.
tooltip.lore: One of Clockwerk's inventions of which he is most proud is the power cog - though it is sometimes despised by his allies.

tooltip.description: Fires a global range flare that explodes over a given area. Upon impact, enemies in the area take damage and are briefly slowed. Rocket flare provides vision over the impact area for 6.0 seconds.
tooltip.lore: What started as a festive display has become a useful scouting and bombardment tool.

tooltip.description: Supercharges Clockwerks abilities: Battery Assault affects all enemies in its range; Clockwerk's attack speed in Power Cogs is increased; Rocket Flares have a reduced cooldown and fire additional rockets to either side of the target; Hookshot stun radius and duration is increased; Jetpack moves faster. Clockwerk's movement and attack speed becomes slowed to a crawl after the duration runs out.
tooltip.lore: Rattletrap understands the limitations of his armor. Just as he understands the risks of pushing past them in times of need.

tooltip.description: Clockwerk activates a jetpack, gaining flying movement, flying vision, and bonus movement speed. Clockwerk has a severely-limited turn rate during this time and cannot attack. Jetpack is cancelled upon casting Hookshot.

Fires a grappling device rapidly at the target location.  If the hook hits a unit, Clockwerk launches himself into the target, stunning and dealing damage to everyone in a 175 radius around the hit target.  Any enemies Clockwerk collides with along the way are damaged and stunned.
tooltip.lore: A somewhat unwieldy device, the Hookshot sends the otherwise clunky Clockwerk armor flying through the air.

use.val: Plant the currently active ward.  Double-Click to switch the currently active ward.

HP regen is lost and the movement speed bonus is reduced to
Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of boots do not stack.

tooltip.description: Clinkz gains attack speed and has bonus attack range. Any current Burning Skeleton Archers skeletons within a 1200 radius of Clinkz also gain bonus attack range and 50% of the attack speed bonus. \n\n Casting Strafe does not break Skeleton Walk invisibility.

Clinkz throws a projectile filled with tar at the target enemy, dealing Magic damage on impact. After impact, the tar spills onto the ground and stays there for 5 seconds. Any enemy that walks across it gets slowed, and attacks from Clinkz or his Burning Army Skeleton Archers will deal bonus physical damage.\n\n When the Tar Bomb hits, any Burning Army skeletons within attack range will attack the target.

Clinkz consumes the target enemy creep or friendly skeleton and creates a Burning Skeleton Archer in their place, healing and gaining max health. Does not take Clinkz out of Skeleton Walk. 

Archers are immobile and die within several attacks from a hero. Skeletons deal a percentage of Clinkz' damage. Attack range is equal to Clinkz's attack range. Only one archer can be summoned from Death Pact at a time.

 Skeletons deal 25% less damage to buildings
tooltip.lore: Sutherex' bond of life and death has become a part of Clinkz, and his old bones are refreshed with repetition of the pact on lesser beings.
tooltip.scepter_description: Increases Skeleton Archer Hits to Kill.

tooltip.description: Summons a row of Burning Skeleton Archers in the target location.
tooltip.lore: Existing on the brink of life and death, Clinkz has learned to temporarily bridge the gap between the two.

tooltip.description: CHANNELED - Clinkz channels and shoots multiple piercing arrows in the target direction that hit all enemy units dealing a percentage of Clinkz' attack damage and applying attack modifiers, and dousing enemies with Tar Bomb slow.
tooltip.lore: It's hard to say whether the blur around the Bone Fletcher is from his flaming heart or his speed with the quiver.

tooltip.description: Clinkz moves invisibly through units until the moment he attacks or uses items. Leaving Skeleton Walk creates Burning Skeleton Archers
tooltip.lore: With a burst of fire and puff of smoke, the Bone Fletcher was nowhere to be seen.

active.val: Roots all enemies in a target

magical damage to each. Lightning proc pierces evasion. Deals

entries.name: x1.5x Flesh Heap Stack Str and Damage Block bonuses

tooltip.description: Launches a bloody hook toward a unit or location. The hook will snag the first unit it encounters, dragging the unit back to Pudge, killing it if it's a non-ancient creep and dealing damage if it is an enemy otherwise.
tooltip.lore: The Butcher's hook is a symbolic nightmare, its curved blade a frightening reminder of his slaughterous intent.

tooltip.description: A toxic cloud that deals intense damage and slows movement--harming not only enemy units but Pudge himself.
tooltip.lore: A foul odor precedes a toxic, choking gas, emanating from the Butcher's putrid, ever-swelling mass.
tooltip.scepter_description: Increases Rot radius and damage, and causes it to reduce enemy health regen.

tooltip.description: Gives Pudge damage block against all sources. Passively grants bonus strength that increases each time Pudge kills an enemy Hero or it dies in his vicinity.  Flesh Heap is retroactive, meaning it can gain charges before it is skilled, which then become active.
tooltip.lore: The Butcher gives new meaning to the words 'meat shield.'

tooltip.description: Ejects the swallowed allied hero inside of you.
tooltip.lore: Allies emerge forever changed.

tooltip.description: CHANNELED - Pudge chows down on an enemy unit, disabling it and dealing damage over time. Damage is increased by Pudge's Strength and heals him for the total amount. Pudge pulls the unit at a rate of 75 units, up to a minimum of 125 range. Lasts longer on creeps.
tooltip.lore: 'When I'm through with these vermin, they'll be fit for a pie!'

active.val: radius blast that causes enemy heroes to take

passive.val: Upgrades the ultimate, and some abilities, of all heroes.

passive.val: magic damage from damage instances over

tooltip.description: A burst of damaging frost slows enemy movement and attack rate in the targeted area.
tooltip.lore: The air temperature around Rylai drops rapidly, chilling all around her to the core.

tooltip.description: Encases an enemy unit in ice, prohibiting movement and attack, while dealing damage over time. Lasts 10 seconds on creeps level 6 or lower.
tooltip.lore: Rylai channels winds from the Blueheart Glacier, imprisoning attackers in thick blocks of ice.

tooltip.description: Gives additional mana regeneration to all friendly units on the map. Allies within a 1200 radius of Crystal Maiden receive 3x the mana regeneration. Crystal Maiden herself receives 7x the bonus.
tooltip.lore: Cold temperatures promote the essence of magic, causing Rylai's presence to allow spell usage in abundance.

tooltip.description: Slides backward, creating a crystal clone of herself in her place and disjointing incoming projectiles. If the clone takes enough damage or times out, it shatters, Frostbiting enemies in a 450 AoE around its place. The Clone can also be destroyed by Crystal Maiden's own spells.
CHANNELED - Surrounds Crystal Maiden with 100 random icy explosions that slow enemies and deal massive damage. Grants bonus armor while channeling. Lasts NaN seconds.
tooltip.lore: Once the place of her exile, Icewrack has become an anchor for Rylai's frigid onslaught.
tooltip.scepter_description: Allows you to move, cast and attack during Freezing Field. Can still be interrupted by enemies. You move -75% slower during this. Increases total number of explosions by +20%. Applies Frostbite to any unit that has been standing in the Freezing Field for over +3.5s.

HP regen is lost and the movement speed bonus is reduced to
Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of boots do not stack.

use.val: Plant the currently active ward.  Double-Click to switch the currently active ward.

passive.val: magic damage from damage instances over

tooltip.description: Consumes a charge to launch a ball of shrapnel that showers the target area in explosive pellets. Enemies are subject to damage and slowed movement. Reveals the targeted area. Shrapnel charges restore every %abilitychargerestoretime% seconds.
tooltip.lore: Kardel's modular rifle also fires incendiary rounds, useful for assaulting entrenched locations.

tooltip.description: Sniper increases his accuracy, giving him a chance to deal extra damage and knock back his enemies. Headshots briefly slow enemy movement and attack speed by -100%.
tooltip.lore: Taking potshots at steepstalkers in his childhood has been thoroughly refined into perfect leads on enemy combatants.

tooltip.description: Extends the attack range of Sniper's rifle. Can be activated to provide 100% Headshot chance and an additional 200 attack range bonus. Slows you by 45, 40, 35, 30% for the duration.
tooltip.lore: Kardel always takes it upon himself to stay as far from harm as he can while still performing his role - taking perfect aim.

tooltip.description: Launches a grenade at the target area, dealing damage to enemies and knocking them and Sniper himself back. Enemies affected are disarmed and have their movement slowed after the knockback.

Sniper locks onto a target enemy unit and, after a short aiming duration, fires a devastating shot that deals Sniper's attack damage plus bonus damage at long range and mini-stuns the target. Whenever Sniper kills an enemy hero, Assassinate is refreshed.
tooltip.lore: In order to fulfill the prophecy and return to his home town, Kardel must make another shot as perfect as the one on the day of his ancient test.
tooltip.scepter_description: Causes Assassinate to fire quicker and stun the enemy target.
